item.title: 新西兰警方在山体滑坡事故后发现人类遗骸
item.description: 新西兰警方在芒格努伊山热门度假胜地一处露营地发现泥石流掩埋的人体遗骸，目前正全力搜寻更多遇难者。【原文：New Zealand police have found human remains beneath mud and debris from a landslide that struck a campsite in the popular holiday spot of Mount Maunganui, and are now moving to recover more victims.】

item.title: 巴西化工集团支付疫情期间发行的混合债券利息
item.description: 据知情人士透露，巴西石化巨头巴西石油化工公司（Braskem SA）已于周五支付了其所谓混合债券的应付利息。【原文：Brazilian petrochemical giant Braskem SA paid interest due Friday on its so-called hybrid bonds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国证交会驳回温克莱沃斯双子星加密贷款诉讼案
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会将撤销该机构2023年对Gemini信托公司的诉讼，此前该机构指控该公司通过未注册的加密货币借贷计划非法募集数十亿美元资金。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission will drop the agency’s 2023 lawsuit against Gemini Trust Co. that accused the firm of illegally raising billions of dollars through an unregistered crypto lending program.】

item.title: 日本债券市场突现动荡，股市多头需警惕
item.description: 自年初以来，日本股市因市场押注首相高市早苗将通过提前大选巩固权力并扩大支出而大幅上涨。然而本周二，所谓的"高市早苗行情"宣告破灭。【原文：From the start of the year, Japanese stocks surged on bets that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi would cement power through a snap election and then ramp up spending. Then on Tuesday, the so-called Takaichi trade unraveled.】

item.title: 英伟达董事佩里斯·德雷尔离任董事会，另谋发展
item.description: 全球市值最高的企业英伟达公司宣布，董事珀西斯·德雷尔将离任董事会，以"追求新的职业机会"。【原文：Nvidia Corp., the world’s most valuable company, announced the departure of director Persis Drell, who is leaving the board to “pursue a new professional opportunity.”】

item.title: 美国安全机构就奥斯汀校车事故对Waymo展开调查
item.description: 美国运输安全调查人员正在调查一系列事件，涉及谷歌母公司Alphabet旗下自动驾驶汽车公司Waymo的无人驾驶汽车在奥斯汀市附近停靠的校车旁行驶不当的情况。【原文：US transportation safety investigators are probing a series of incidents in which self-driving cars operated by Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo unit drove improperly near parked school buses in Austin.】

item.title: 惠誉上调土耳其评级展望，穆迪维持不变
item.description: 惠誉评级周五将土耳其评级展望从稳定上调至正面，原因是通胀持续回落且外汇储备充裕。【原文：Fitch Ratings upgraded Turkey’s rating outlook to positive from stable on Friday, owing to a continued decline in inflation and strong foreign currency reserves.】

item.title: AMC与债券持有人展开谈判，引发债券价格暴跌
item.description: AMC娱乐控股公司的一批债券持有人正与这家影院连锁企业展开保密谈判，引发部分债券价格暴跌，市场担忧可能有更广泛的债务重组行动正在酝酿。【原文：A group of AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. bondholders is kicking off confidential talks with the theater chain, prompting some of its notes to tumble amid concerns a broader debt move may be afoot.】

item.title: SpaceX的市值足以装进一只ETF。为何更多基金不持有它？
item.description: 交易所交易基金正涉足私募市场，但鲜有基金像罗伯·巴伦那样对SpaceX进行如此大举押注。【原文：ETF’s are dabbling in private markets, but few are going as full-throttled on SpaceX as Rob Baron.】

item.title: 贝莱德将私募债务基金估值下调19%，并免除相关费用
item.description: 贝莱德旗下私募债务基金预计将资产净值下调19%，此前一系列问题贷款拖累了业绩，这标志着私募信贷市场面临的压力进一步显现。【原文：A BlackRock Inc. private debt fund expects to mark down the net value of its assets 19% after a string of troubled loans weighed on results, marking the latest sign of pressure in the private credit market.】

item.title: 对冲基金加码看涨原油押注，伊朗与哈萨克斯坦供应风险加剧
item.description: 对冲基金加大原油看涨押注，升至8月以来最高水平。此举源于黑海地区供应中断，以及美国对伊朗（全球主要产油国之一）政策走向的不确定性。【原文：Hedge funds upped bullish wagers on crude to the highest since August amid supply disruptions in the Black Sea region and uncertainty surrounding Washington’s plans for Iran, one of the world’s top producers.】

item.title: 玛拉·高恩卡的对冲基金资产三年内突破60亿美元
item.description: 马拉·高恩卡的对冲基金在成立仅三年后，资产规模便激增至约60亿美元，创下史上增长最快的新基金纪录之一。【原文：Mala Gaonkar’s hedge fund tripled its assets to about $6 billion just three years after it started trading, marking one of the fastest-growing debuts in history.】

item.title: 标普上调刚果信用展望 该国即将发行首只欧元债券
item.description: 标普全球评级上调了刚果民主共和国主权信用评级展望，该国正筹备首次发行欧元债券。【原文：S&P Global Ratings upgraded the outlook on the Democratic Republic of Congo’s sovereign credit rating, as the country prepares its first-ever eurobond offering.】

item.title: 在特朗普市场中，突如其来的波动是做生意的代价
item.description: 美国突然对欧洲加征关税的威胁，引发了本周以来最同步的市场抛售潮——这波疫情以来罕见的市场动荡，让交易员们开始质疑那些曾经可靠的对冲策略。【原文：The abrupt threat of US tariffs on Europe triggered one of the most synchronized market selloffs this week since the pandemic — and had traders second-guessing once-reliable hedges.】

item.title: TikTok新任CEO兼具好莱坞人脉与字节跳动忠诚度
item.description: TikTok任命内部人士领导其新设立的美国业务部门，选定了一位与娱乐界渊源深厚、且曾向字节跳动有限公司高层汇报工作的管理人员。【原文：TikTok picked an insider to lead its newly created US business, choosing an executive with deep ties to the entertainment world and history reporting up to ByteDance Ltd.’s leadership.】

item.title: 对冲基金增持黄金多头头寸至16周高位
item.description: 基金经理们加大了对黄金的看涨押注，达到10月以来的最高水平。由于对格陵兰岛的担忧促使投资者将资金从货币和主权债券转向实物资产。【原文：Money managers increased their bullish wagers on gold to the highest since October as anxieties over Greenland prompted investors to rotate into hard assets away from currencies and sovereign bonds.】

item.title: 得州风电量微弱，强劲冬季风暴来袭
item.description: 得克萨斯州电网运营商预测，本周末风力发电量将非常有限——而风能是该地区的重要电力来源——与此同时，一场迫在眉睫的重大冬季风暴预计将引发电力需求的激增。【原文：The Texas grid operator is forecasting very little wind generation — a key source of power — over the weekend just as a nearing major winter storm promises to prompt a surge in electricity demand.】

item.title: 日元汇率创8月以来最大涨幅，因干预风险升温
item.description: 日元汇率突然出现近六个月来最大单日涨幅，市场猜测日本当局可能正准备采取非常规干预措施以阻止日元贬值。【原文：The yen abruptly staged its biggest one-day surge in nearly six months on speculation that Japanese authorities could be preparing to mount an unusual market intervention to halt the currency’s slide.】

item.title: 据称厄瓜多尔计划重返债券市场，拟发行40亿美元债券
item.description: 据知情人士透露，厄瓜多尔计划通过首次债券发行筹集高达40亿美元资金，这是该国自2019年以来的首次债券发行，最早可能于下周启动。【原文：Ecuador is planning to raise as much as $4 billion in its first bond sale since 2019, which could come as soon as next week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 字节跳动在TikTok风波中赢得"重大胜利"，成功获得美国市场准入
item.description: 历经近七年、三届美国总统任期以及近乎全面的禁令，字节跳动有限公司在与华盛顿的对峙中取得了决定性胜利。【原文：After almost seven years, three US presidencies and a near-total ban, ByteDance Ltd. has secured a definitive victory in its standoff with Washington.】

item.title: 英特尔股价暴跌恐将侵蚀特朗普力挺的复苏势头
item.description: 英特尔股价的下跌，正让特朗普总统关于由美国企业领衔快速重振国内芯片制造业的愿景面临现实考验。此前四个月，美国政府曾试图收购该公司高达10%的股权。【原文：Intel Corp.’s stock slide is delivering a reality check to President Donald Trump’s vision for quickly reviving domestic chip manufacturing led by an American champion, four months after the US moved to acquire as much as a 10% stake in the company.】

item.title: 里德尔的市场支持与美联储计划被视为对主席职位的助力
item.description: 据熟悉白宫决策过程的人士透露，里克·里德在华尔街的资历以及对美联储改革持开放态度的立场，已为其角逐央行最高职位增添了砝码。【原文：Rick Rieder’s Wall Street bona fides and openness to making changes at the Federal Reserve have bolstered his candidacy for the central bank’s top job, according to people familiar with the White House deliberations.】

item.title: 巴拉圭央行意外降息25个基点
item.description: 巴拉圭央行意外将基准利率下调0.25个百分点至5.75%，理由是通胀预期趋稳且消费物价增速放缓。【原文：Paraguay’s central bank unexpectedly cut the benchmark interest rate a quarter point to 5.75%, citing anchored inflation expectations and slowing consumer prices.】

item.title: Meta与依视路陆逊梯卡因智能眼镜专利案遭起诉
item.description: 在智能眼镜领域持续领跑的Meta Platforms公司，近日因专利侵权遭到另一家眼镜制造商起诉。该诉讼同时将视力保健巨头依视路陆逊梯卡公司及其旗下奥克利品牌列为被告。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc., the reigning leader in the growing smart glasses category, is being sued by another glasses maker over patent infringement in a case that also targets eyewear giant EssilorLuxottica SA and its Oakley subsidiary.】

item.title: 对冲基金交易蓬勃发展，得益于互换利差的飙升
item.description: 交易员正纷纷重返一种热门对冲基金策略，该策略押注美国国债将跑赢利率互换。【原文：Traders are piling back into a popular hedge fund strategy that bets on US Treasuries outperforming interest rate swaps.】

item.title: 明星人工智能研究员新实验室估值达40亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，著名人工智能研究员理查德·索彻正就为一家名为Recursive的新创公司筹集数亿美元资金进行谈判，该公司致力于构建更先进的人工智能系统。【原文：Famed artificial intelligence researcher Richard Socher is in talks to raise hundreds of millions of dollars for a new startup called Recursive that’s focused on building more advanced AI systems, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴克莱认为市政债券市场上涨空间受高估值限制
item.description: 据巴克莱银行策略师称，市政债券市场持续跑赢大盘的势头可能已所剩无几。【原文：The muni market’s outperformance streak likely has little room left to run, according to Barclays Plc strategists.】

item.title: 这本该是个绝佳的市场，可惜无人交易。
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读本期通讯，这里汇集了Odd Lots世界每日精选内容。有时是我们——乔·韦森塔尔和特蕾西·阿洛威——为您解读市场、金融与经济领域的最新动态；有时则是来自专家嘉宾和信息源网络的深度贡献。无论内容如何，我们保证始终精彩纷呈。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉投资者面临法律雷区，因美国调整立场
item.description: 有意参与白宫振兴委内瑞拉石油经济计划的投资者，可能因外交承认问题陷入政治与法律的雷区。【原文：Investors who want to take part in the White House’s plans to revitalize Venezuela’s oil-based economy are at risk of stepping into a political and legal minefield over diplomatic recognition.】

item.title: 软件制造商Databricks敲定18亿美元融资方案
item.description: 软件制造商Databricks公司已从广泛的银团贷款投资者和私募信贷机构处筹集到18亿美元的新融资。【原文：Software maker Databricks Inc. has lined up $1.8 billion of new financing from broadly syndicated loan investors and private credit lenders.】
